column4: how would I go about installing a new windows manager? specifically scrotwm
i'm new to the command line
now that i've installed in, how owuld I go about enabling it?
if you use a DM, log out an choose it.
i don't understand?  are you in scrotwm or not?
i doubt scrotwm is autoconfigured (it technically should be though).  One option might be to stop your DM and use "startx" after configuring the proper exec line in .xinitrc
are you suggesting that I use something called Ubuntu Oneiric?
if you start slim then use f2 at your gui login screen to select your WM
but lightdm didn't have scrotwm did it?
oh sorry - i though it wasn't listed!
how would I go about uninstalling slim and changing lightdm back the "default?"
sudo apt-get uninstall slim, did you change the default DM?
just uninstall slim, and the conf won't matter.  the .xinitrc will only apply if you are using startx
